intro: Polystachya bicalcarata, commonly known as the two-awned polystachya, is a member of the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly Madagascar, and is characterized by its striking, pendulous inflorescences. The plant features elongated, narrow leaves and produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts interested in rare orchids.
